}} 'Kollam district' (formerly Quilon) is one of 14 districts of the state of
Kerala, India. The district has a cross-section of Kerala's natural attributes;
it is endowed with a long coastline, a major Arabian Sea seaport and an inland
lake (Ashtamudi Lake). Kollam is the capital of Kerala's cashew industry.
Plains, mountains, lakes, lagoons and backwaters, forests, farmland and rivers
make up the topography of the district. The area had trading relationships with
Phoenicia and Ancient Rome. About 30 percent of the district is covered by
Ashtamudi Lake, making it a gateway to the Kerala
backwaters. The Thevalakara and Thekkumbagam panchyaths established the ancient
korekini ("sea pointed inland") port of Tarsish in 1500 BC. Kollam is also known
as The God's Own Capital. http://kollam.nic.in/default.htm
